00054 /*****************************************************************************\
00055  * NOTICE OF CONVENTION                                                      *
00056  * ------------------------------------------------------------------------- *
00057  * Mspec links to Pcode, Hcode, and Lcode modules.  In order to allow this   *
00058  * to take place without requiring front-end modules to link to liblcode.a,  *
00059  * Mspec code is divided into two classes as follows:                        *
00060  *  - mi_*.c must not depend on linkage to liblcode.a                        *
00061  *  - ml_*.c may depend on linkage to liblcode.a                             *
00062 \*****************************************************************************/

00089 /*
00090  *      The following functions are for documentation only.
00091  *      The function overhead is too great for actual usage.
00092  */
00093 void
00094 M_void (M_Type type)
00095 {
00096   /* Use layout database (if specified) to determine info -ITI/JCG 2/99 */
00097   if (M_use_layout_database)
00098     {
00099       type->type = M_TYPE_VOID;
00100       type->unsign = 1;
00101       type->align = -1;         /* No database read necessary, 
00102                                    IMPACT convention */
00103       type->size = 0;           /* No database read necessary, 
00104                                    IMPACT convention */
00105       type->nbits = 0;          /* No database read necessary, 
00106                                    IMPACT convention */
00107     }
00108   /* Otherwise use orig hard-coded method to determine info -ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
00109   else
00110     {
00111       switch (M_arch)
00112         {
00113         case M_IMPACT:
00114           M_impact_void (type);
00115           break;
00116         case M_TAHOE:
00117           M_tahoe_void (type);
00118           break;
00119         case M_SPARC:
00120           M_sparc_void (type);
00121           break;
00122         case M_HPPA:
00123           M_hppa_void (type);
00124           break;
00125         case M_X86:
00126           M_x86_void (type);
00127           break;
00128         case M_PLAYDOH:
00129           M_playdoh_void (type);
00130           break;
00131         case M_TI:
00132           M_ti_void (type);
00133           break;
00134         case M_SH:
00135           M_sh_void (type);
00136           break;
00137         case M_BX86:
00138           M_bx86_void (type);
00139           break;
00140         case M_STARCORE:
00141           M_starcore_void (type);
00142           break;
00143         case M_ARM:
00144           M_arm_void (type);
00145           break;
00146         case M_WIMS:
00147           M_wims_void (type);
00148           break;
00149         default:
00150           M_assert (0, "M_void: illegal M_arch type");
00151         }
00152     }
00153   type->flags = 0;
00154 }
00155 
00156 void
00157 M_bit_llong (M_Type type, int n, int unsign)
00158 {
00159   /* Use layout database (if specified) to determine info -ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
00160   if (M_use_layout_database)
00161     {
00162       type->type = M_TYPE_BIT_LLONG;
00163       type->unsign = (unsign != 0);
00164       type->align = 1;          /* No database read necessary, 
00165                                    IMPACT convention */
00166       type->size = n;           /* No database read necessary, 
00167                                    IMPACT convention */
00168       type->nbits = n;          /* No database read necessary, 
00169                                    IMPACT convention */
00170       if (n > M_read_database_i ("_HT__base_types", "longlong", "size"))
00171         {
00172           I_punt ("M_bit_long: bit field (%i) more than %i bits",
00173                   n, M_read_database_i ("_HT__base_types", "longlong",
00174                                         "size"));
00175         }
00176     }
00177   /* Otherwise use orig hard-coded method to determine info -ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
00178   else
00179     {
00180       switch (M_arch)
00181         {
00182         case M_TAHOE:
00183           M_tahoe_bit_llong (type, n);
00184           break;
00185         default:
00186           M_assert (0, "M_bit_llong: illegal M_arch type");
00187         }
00188     }
00189   type->flags = 0;
00190 }
00191 
00192 /* Added 'unsign' parameter, phase in use -ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
00193 void
00194 M_bit_long (M_Type type, int n, int unsign)
00195 {
00196   /* Use layout database (if specified) to determine info -ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
00197   if (M_use_layout_database)
00198     {
00199       type->type = M_TYPE_BIT_LONG;
00200       type->unsign = (unsign != 0);
00201       type->align = 1;          /* No database read necessary, 
00202                                    IMPACT convention */
00203       type->size = n;           /* No database read necessary, 
00204                                    IMPACT convention */
00205       type->nbits = n;          /* No database read necessary, 
00206                                    IMPACT convention */
00207       if (n > M_read_database_i ("_HT__base_types", "long", "size"))
00208         {
00209           I_punt ("M_bit_long: bit field (%i) more than %i bits",
00210                   n, M_read_database_i ("_HT__base_types", "long", "size"));
00211         }
00212     }
00213   /* Otherwise use orig hard-coded method to determine info -ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
00214   else
00215     {
00216       switch (M_arch)
00217         {
00218         case M_IMPACT:
00219           M_impact_bit_long (type, n);
00220           break;
00221         case M_TAHOE:
00222           M_tahoe_bit_long (type, n);
00223           break;
00224         case M_SPARC:
00225           M_sparc_bit_long (type, n);
00226           break;
00227         case M_HPPA:
00228           M_hppa_bit_long (type, n);
00229           break;
00230         case M_X86:
00231           M_x86_bit_long (type, n);
00232           break;
00233         case M_PLAYDOH:
00234           M_playdoh_bit_long (type, n);
00235           break;
00236         case M_TI:
00237           M_ti_bit_long (type, n);
00238           break;
00239         case M_SH:
00240           M_sh_bit_long (type, n);
00241           break;
00242         case M_BX86:
00243           M_bx86_bit_long (type, n);
00244           break;
00245         case M_STARCORE:
00246           M_starcore_bit_long (type, n);
00247           break;
00248         case M_ARM:
00249           M_arm_bit_long (type, n);
00250           break;
00251         case M_WIMS:
00252           M_wims_bit_long (type, n);
00253           break;
00254         default:
00255           M_assert (0, "M_bit_long: illegal M_arch type");
00256         }
00257     }
00258   type->flags = 0;
00259 }

00262 void
00263 M_bit_int (M_Type type, int n, int unsign)
00264 {
00265   /* Use layout database (if specified) to determine info -ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
00266   if (M_use_layout_database)
00267     {
00268       type->type = M_TYPE_BIT_INT;
00269       type->unsign = (unsign != 0);
00270       type->align = 1;          /* No database read necessary, 
00271                                    IMPACT convention */
00272       type->size = n;           /* No database read necessary, 
00273                                    IMPACT convention */
00274       type->nbits = n;          /* No database read necessary, 
00275                                    IMPACT convention */
00276       if (n > M_read_database_i ("_HT__base_types", "int", "size"))
00277         {
00278           I_punt ("M_bit_int: bit field (%i) more than %i bits",
00279                   n, M_read_database_i ("_HT__base_types", "int", "size"));
00280         }
00281     }
00282   /* Otherwise use orig hard-coded method to determine info -ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
00283   else
00284     {
00285       switch (M_arch)
00286         {
00287         case M_IMPACT:
00288           M_impact_bit_int (type, n);
00289           break;
00290         case M_TAHOE:
00291           M_tahoe_bit_int (type, n);
00292           break;
00293         case M_SPARC:
00294           M_sparc_bit_int (type, n);
00295           break;
00296         case M_HPPA:
00297           M_hppa_bit_int (type, n);
00298           break;
00299         case M_X86:
00300           M_x86_bit_int (type, n);
00301           break;
00302         case M_PLAYDOH:
00303           M_playdoh_bit_int (type, n);
00304           break;
00305         case M_TI:
00306           M_ti_bit_int (type, n);
00307           break;
00308         case M_SH:
00309           M_sh_bit_int (type, n);
00310           break;
00311         case M_BX86:
00312           M_bx86_bit_int (type, n);
00313           break;
00314         case M_STARCORE:
00315           M_starcore_bit_int (type, n);
00316           break;
00317         case M_ARM:
00318           M_arm_bit_int (type, n);
00319           break;
00320         case M_WIMS:
00321           M_wims_bit_int (type, n);
00322           break;
00323         default:
00324           M_assert (0, "M_bit_int: illegal M_arch type");
00325         }
00326     }
00327   type->flags = 0;
00328 }

00330 /* Added 'unsign' parameter, phase in use -ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
00331 void
00332 M_bit_short (M_Type type, int n, int unsign)
00333 {
00334   /* Use layout database (if specified) to determine info -ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
00335   if (M_use_layout_database)
00336     {
00337       type->type = M_TYPE_BIT_SHORT;
00338       type->unsign = (unsign != 0);
00339       type->align = 1;          /* No database read necessary, 
00340                                    IMPACT convention */
00341       type->size = n;           /* No database read necessary, 
00342                                    IMPACT convention */
00343       type->nbits = n;          /* No database read necessary, 
00344                                    IMPACT convention */
00345       if (n > M_read_database_i ("_HT__base_types", "short", "size"))
00346         {
00347           I_punt ("M_bit_short: bit field (%i) more than %i bits",
00348                   n, M_read_database_i ("_HT__base_types", "short", "size"));
00349         }
00350     }
00351   /* Otherwise use orig hard-coded method to determine info -ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
00352   else
00353     {
00354       switch (M_arch)
00355         {
00356         case M_IMPACT:
00357           M_impact_bit_short (type, n);
00358           break;
00359         case M_TAHOE:
00360           M_tahoe_bit_short (type, n);
00361           break;
00362         case M_SPARC:
00363           M_sparc_bit_short (type, n);
00364           break;
00365         case M_HPPA:
00366           M_hppa_bit_short (type, n);
00367           break;
00368         case M_X86:
00369           M_x86_bit_short (type, n);
00370           break;
00371         case M_PLAYDOH:
00372           M_playdoh_bit_short (type, n);
00373           break;
00374         case M_TI:
00375           M_ti_bit_short (type, n);
00376           break;

00378           M_sh_bit_short (type, n);
00379           break;
00380         case M_BX86:

00382           break;

00385           break;
00386         case M_ARM:

00401 M_bit_char (M_Type type, int n, int unsign)

00405     {

00409                                    IMPACT convention */
00410       type->size = n;           /* No database read necessary, 
00411                                    IMPACT convention */
00412       type->nbits = n;          /* No database read necessary, 
00413                                    IMPACT convention */
00414       if (n > M_read_database_i ("_HT__base_types", "char", "size"))
00415         {
00416           I_punt ("M_bit_char: bit field (%i) more than %i bits",
00417                   n, M_read_database_i ("_HT__base_types", "char", "size"));
00418         }
00419     }
00420   /* Otherwise use orig hard-coded method to determine info -ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
00421   else

00468 void
00469 M_float (M_Type type, int unsign)
00470 {
00471   /* Use layout database (if specified) to determine info -ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
00472   if (M_use_layout_database)
00473     {
00474       type->type = M_TYPE_FLOAT;
00475       type->unsign = (unsign != 0);
00476       type->align = M_read_database_i ("_HT__base_types", "float", "align");
00477       type->size = M_read_database_i ("_HT__base_types", "float", "size");
00478       type->nbits = M_read_database_i ("_HT__base_types", "float", "size");
00479     }
00480   /* Otherwise use orig hard-coded method to determine info -ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
00481   else
00482     {
00483       switch (M_arch)
00484         {
00485         case M_IMPACT:
00486           M_impact_float (type, unsign);
00487           break;
00488         case M_TAHOE:
00489           M_tahoe_float (type, unsign);
00490           break;
00491         case M_SPARC:
00492           M_sparc_float (type, unsign);
00493           break;
00494         case M_HPPA:
00495           M_hppa_float (type, unsign);
00496           break;
00497         case M_X86:
00498           M_x86_float (type, unsign);
00499           break;
00500         case M_PLAYDOH:
00501           M_playdoh_float (type, unsign);
00502           break;
00503         case M_TI:
00504           M_ti_float (type, unsign);
00505           break;
00506         case M_SH:
00507           M_sh_float (type, unsign);
00508           break;
00509         case M_BX86:
00510           M_bx86_float (type, unsign);
00511           break;
00512         case M_STARCORE:
00513           M_starcore_float (type, unsign);
00514           break;
00515         case M_ARM:
00516           M_arm_float (type, unsign);
00517           break;
00518         case M_WIMS:
00519           M_wims_float (type, unsign);
00520           break;
00521         default:
00522           M_assert (0, "M_float: illegal M_arch type");
00523         }
00524     }
00525   type->flags = 0;
00526 }

00528 void
00529 M_double (M_Type type, int unsign)
00530 {
00531   /* Use layout database (if specified) to determine info -ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
00532   if (M_use_layout_database)
00533     {
00534       type->type = M_TYPE_DOUBLE;
00535       type->unsign = (unsign != 0);
00536       type->align = M_read_database_i ("_HT__base_types", "double", "align");
00537       type->size = M_read_database_i ("_HT__base_types", "double", "size");
00538       type->nbits = M_read_database_i ("_HT__base_types", "double", "size");
00539     }
00540   /* Otherwise use orig hard-coded method to determine info -ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
00541   else
00542     {
00543       switch (M_arch)
00544         {
00545         case M_IMPACT:
00546           M_impact_double (type, unsign);
00547           break;
00548         case M_TAHOE:
00549           M_tahoe_double (type, unsign);
00550           break;
00551         case M_SPARC:
00552           M_sparc_double (type, unsign);
00553           break;
00554         case M_HPPA:
00555           M_hppa_double (type, unsign);
00556           break;
00557         case M_X86:
00558           M_x86_double (type, unsign);
00559           break;
00560         case M_PLAYDOH:
00561           M_playdoh_double (type, unsign);
00562           break;
00563         case M_TI:
00564           M_ti_double (type, unsign);
00565           break;
00566         case M_SH:
00567           M_sh_double (type, unsign);
00568           break;
00569         case M_BX86:
00570           M_bx86_double (type, unsign);
00571           break;
00572         case M_STARCORE:
00573           M_starcore_double (type, unsign);
00574           break;
00575         case M_ARM:
00576           M_arm_double (type, unsign);
00577           break;
00578         case M_WIMS:
00579           M_wims_double (type, unsign);
00580           break;
00581         default:
00582           M_assert (0, "M_double: illegal M_arch type");
00583         }
00584     }
00585   type->flags = 0;
00586 }

00588 void
00589 M_pointer (M_Type type)
00590 {
00591   /* Use layout database (if specified) to determine info -ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
00592   if (M_use_layout_database)
00593     {
00594       type->type = M_TYPE_POINTER;
00595       type->unsign = 1;
00596       type->align = M_read_database_i ("_HT__base_types", "void *", "align");
00597       type->size = M_read_database_i ("_HT__base_types", "void *", "size");
00598       type->nbits = M_read_database_i ("_HT__base_types", "void *", "size");
00599     }
00600   /* Otherwise use orig hard-coded method to determine info -ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
00601   else
00602     {
00603       switch (M_arch)
00604         {
00605         case M_IMPACT:
00606           M_impact_pointer (type);
00607           break;
00608         case M_TAHOE:
00609           M_tahoe_pointer (type);
00610           break;
00611         case M_SPARC:
00612           M_sparc_pointer (type);
00613           break;
00614         case M_HPPA:
00615           M_hppa_pointer (type);
00616           break;
00617         case M_X86:
00618           M_x86_pointer (type);
00619           break;
00620         case M_PLAYDOH:
00621           M_playdoh_pointer (type);
00622           break;
00623         case M_TI:
00624           M_ti_pointer (type);
00625           break;
00626         case M_SH:
00627           M_sh_pointer (type);
00628           break;
00629         case M_BX86:
00630           M_bx86_pointer (type);
00631           break;
00632         case M_STARCORE:
00633           M_starcore_pointer (type);
00634           break;
00635         case M_ARM:
00636           M_arm_pointer (type);
00637           break;
00638         case M_WIMS:
00639           M_wims_pointer (type);
00640           break;
00641         default:
00642           M_assert (0, "M_pointer: illegal M_arch type");
00643         }
00644     }
00645   type->flags = 0;
00646 }
00647 
00648 void
00649 M_union (M_Type type, int align, int size)
00650 {
00651   type->type = M_TYPE_UNION;
00652   type->unsign = 1;
00653   type->align = align;
00654   type->size = size;
00655   type->nbits = size;
00656 #ifdef TEST_SIZE
00657   if (size < 0)
00658     M_assert (0, "M_union: size cannot be negative");
00659   if (align < 0)
00660     M_assert (0, "M_union: align cannot be negative");
00661 #endif
00662   type->flags = 0;
00663 }
00664 
00665 void
00666 M_struct (M_Type type, int align, int size)
00667 {
00668   type->type = M_TYPE_STRUCT;
00669   type->unsign = 1;
00670   type->align = align;
00671   type->size = size;
00672   type->nbits = size;
00673 #ifdef TEST_SIZE
00674   if (size < 0)
00675     M_assert (0, "M_struct: size cannot be negative");
00676   if (align < 0)
00677     M_assert (0, "M_struct: align cannot be negative");
00678 #endif
00679   type->flags = 0;
00680 }
00681 
00682 void
00683 M_block (M_Type type, int align, int size)
00684 {
00685   type->type = M_TYPE_BLOCK;
00686   type->unsign = 1;
00687   type->align = align;
00688   type->size = size;
00689   type->nbits = size;
00690 #ifdef TEST_SIZE
00691   if (type->size < 0)
00692     M_assert (0, "M_block: size cannot be negative");
00693   if (type->align < 0)
00694     M_assert (0, "M_block: align cannot be negative");
00695 #endif
00696 }
00697 
00698 int
00699 M_eval_type (M_Type type, M_Type ntype)
00700 {
00701   int native_mtype = M_native_int_register_mtype ();
00702 
00703   /* Use layout database (if specified) to determine info -ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
00704   if (M_use_layout_database)
00705     {
00706       /* Based on hppa version, which seems wierd.  However, since
00707        * M_eval_type2 does what I expect it to, is seems unwise to change
00708        * this code. -ITI (JCG) 2/99 */
00709       switch (type->type)
00710         {
00711         case M_TYPE_VOID:
00712           M_void (ntype);
00713           return -1;            /* can not be evaluated */
00714         case M_TYPE_BIT_LONG:
00715         case M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR:
00716         case M_TYPE_CHAR:
00717         case M_TYPE_SHORT:
00718         case M_TYPE_INT:
00719         case M_TYPE_LONG:
00720         case M_TYPE_LLONG:
00721         case M_TYPE_POINTER:
00722         case M_TYPE_BLOCK:      /* the starting address of array is used */
00723           /* The promoted size is machine dependent. MCM 7/00 */
00724           if (native_mtype == M_TYPE_INT)
00725             M_int (ntype, type->unsign);
00726           else if (native_mtype == M_TYPE_LLONG)
00727             M_llong (ntype, type->unsign);
00728           else
00729             I_punt ("M_eval_type: Invalid native machine mtype %d\n",
00730                     native_mtype);
00731           return (ntype->type);
00732         case M_TYPE_FLOAT:
00733           M_float (ntype, type->unsign);
00734           return M_TYPE_FLOAT;
00735         case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:
00736           M_double (ntype, type->unsign);
00737           return M_TYPE_DOUBLE;
00738         case M_TYPE_UNION:
00739         case M_TYPE_STRUCT:
00740           *ntype = *type;
00741           return type->type;
00742         default:
00743           return (-1);
00744         }
00745     }
00746   /* Otherwise use orig hard-coded method to determine info -ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
00747   else
00748     {
00749       switch (M_arch)
00750         {
00751         case M_IMPACT:
00752           return M_impact_eval_type (type, ntype);
00753         case M_TAHOE:
00754           return M_tahoe_eval_type (type, ntype);
00755         case M_SPARC:
00756           return M_sparc_eval_type (type, ntype);
00757         case M_HPPA:
00758           return M_hppa_eval_type (type, ntype);
00759         case M_X86:
00760           return M_x86_eval_type (type, ntype);
00761         case M_PLAYDOH:
00762           return M_playdoh_eval_type (type, ntype);
00763         case M_TI:
00764           return M_ti_eval_type (type, ntype);
00765         case M_SH:
00766           return M_sh_eval_type (type, ntype);
00767         case M_BX86:
00768           return M_bx86_eval_type (type, ntype);
00769         case M_STARCORE:
00770           return M_starcore_eval_type (type, ntype);
00771         case M_ARM:
00772           return M_arm_eval_type (type, ntype);
00773         case M_WIMS:
00774           return M_wims_eval_type (type, ntype);
00775         default:
00776           M_assert (0, "M_eval_type: illegal M_arch type");
00777           return -1;
00778         }
00779     }
00780 }
00781 
00782 int
00783 M_eval_type2 (M_Type type, M_Type ntype)
00784 {
00785   /* Use layout database (if specified) to determine info -ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
00786   if (M_use_layout_database)
00787     {
00788       switch (type->type)
00789         {
00790         case M_TYPE_VOID:
00791           M_void (ntype);
00792           return -1;            /* can not be evaluated */
00793         case M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR:
00794         case M_TYPE_CHAR:
00795           M_char (ntype, type->unsign);
00796           return M_TYPE_CHAR;
00797         case M_TYPE_BIT_SHORT:  /* -ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
00798         case M_TYPE_SHORT:
00799           M_short (ntype, type->unsign);
00800           return M_TYPE_SHORT;
00801         case M_TYPE_BLOCK:      /* the starting address of array is used */
00802         case M_TYPE_INT:
00803           M_int (ntype, type->unsign);
00804           return M_TYPE_INT;
00805         case M_TYPE_BIT_LONG:
00806         case M_TYPE_LONG:
00807           M_long (ntype, type->unsign);
00808           return M_TYPE_LONG;
00809         case M_TYPE_BIT_LLONG:
00810         case M_TYPE_LLONG:
00811           M_llong (ntype, type->unsign);
00812           return M_TYPE_LLONG;
00813         case M_TYPE_POINTER:
00814           M_pointer (ntype);
00815           return M_TYPE_POINTER;
00816         case M_TYPE_FLOAT:
00817           M_float (ntype, type->unsign);
00818           return M_TYPE_FLOAT;
00819         case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:
00820           M_double (ntype, type->unsign);
00821           return M_TYPE_DOUBLE;
00822         case M_TYPE_UNION:
00823         case M_TYPE_STRUCT:
00824           *ntype = *type;
00825           return type->type;
00826         default:                /* -ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
00827           return (-1);
00828         }
00829     }
00830   /* Otherwise use orig hard-coded method to determine info -ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
00831   else
00832     {
00833       switch (M_arch)
00834         {
00835         case M_IMPACT:
00836           return M_impact_eval_type2 (type, ntype);
00837         case M_TAHOE:
00838           return M_tahoe_eval_type2 (type, ntype);
00839         case M_SPARC:
00840           return M_sparc_eval_type2 (type, ntype);
00841         case M_HPPA:
00842           return M_hppa_eval_type2 (type, ntype);
00843         case M_X86:
00844           return M_x86_eval_type2 (type, ntype);
00845         case M_PLAYDOH:
00846           return M_playdoh_eval_type2 (type, ntype);
00847         case M_TI:
00848           return M_ti_eval_type2 (type, ntype);
00849         case M_SH:
00850           return M_sh_eval_type2 (type, ntype);
00851         case M_BX86:
00852           return M_bx86_eval_type2 (type, ntype);
00853         case M_STARCORE:
00854           return M_starcore_eval_type2 (type, ntype);
00855         case M_ARM:
00856           return M_arm_eval_type2 (type, ntype);
00857         case M_WIMS:
00858           return M_wims_eval_type2 (type, ntype);
00859         default:
00860           M_assert (0, "M_eval_type2: illegal M_arch type");
00861           return -1;
00862         }
00863     }
00864 }
00865 
00866 int
00867 M_call_type (M_Type type, M_Type ntype)
00868 {
00869   int native_mtype = M_native_int_register_mtype ();
00870 
00871   /* Use layout database (if specified) to determine info -ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
00872   /* Used when parameter ctypes are not propagated, rather the parmeters
00873      are promoted to machine word size. */
00874   if (M_use_layout_database)
00875     {
00876       switch (type->type)
00877         {
00878         case M_TYPE_VOID:
00879           M_void (ntype);
00880           return -1;            /* can not be evaluated */
00881         case M_TYPE_BIT_LONG:
00882         case M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR:
00883         case M_TYPE_CHAR:
00884         case M_TYPE_SHORT:
00885         case M_TYPE_INT:
00886         case M_TYPE_LONG:
00887         case M_TYPE_LLONG:
00888         case M_TYPE_POINTER:
00889         case M_TYPE_BLOCK:      /* the starting address of array is used */
00890           /* The promoted size is machine dependent. MCM 7/00 */
00891           if (native_mtype == M_TYPE_INT)
00892             M_int (ntype, type->unsign);
00893           else if (native_mtype == M_TYPE_LLONG)
00894             M_llong (ntype, type->unsign);
00895           else
00896             I_punt ("M_call_type: Invalid native machine mtype %d\n",
00897                     native_mtype);
00898           return (ntype->type);
00899           /* BCC - don't promote float to double now - 8/5/96 */
00900         case M_TYPE_FLOAT:
00901           M_float (ntype, type->unsign);
00902           return M_TYPE_FLOAT;
00903         case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:
00904           M_double (ntype, type->unsign);
00905           return M_TYPE_DOUBLE;
00906         case M_TYPE_UNION:
00907         case M_TYPE_STRUCT:
00908           *ntype = *type;
00909           return type->type;
00910         default:
00911           return (-1);
00912         }
00913     }
00914   /* Otherwise use orig hard-coded method to determine info -ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
00915   else
00916     {
00917       switch (M_arch)
00918         {
00919         case M_IMPACT:
00920           return M_impact_call_type (type, ntype);
00921         case M_TAHOE:
00922           return M_tahoe_call_type (type, ntype);
00923         case M_SPARC:
00924           return M_sparc_call_type (type, ntype);
00925         case M_HPPA:
00926           return M_hppa_call_type (type, ntype);
00927         case M_X86:
00928           return M_x86_call_type (type, ntype);
00929         case M_PLAYDOH:
00930           return M_playdoh_call_type (type, ntype);
00931         case M_TI:
00932           return M_ti_call_type (type, ntype);
00933         case M_SH:
00934           return M_sh_call_type (type, ntype);
00935         case M_STARCORE:
00936           return M_starcore_call_type (type, ntype);
00937         case M_ARM:
00938           return M_arm_call_type (type, ntype);
00939         case M_WIMS:
00940           return M_wims_call_type (type, ntype);
00941         default:
00942           M_assert (0, "M_call_type: illegal M_arch type");
00943           return -1;
00944         }
00945     }
00946 }
00947 
00948 int
00949 M_call_type2 (M_Type type, M_Type ntype)
00950 {
00951   /* Use layout database (if specified) to determine info -ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
00952   if (M_use_layout_database)
00953     {
00954       switch (type->type)
00955         {
00956         case M_TYPE_VOID:
00957           M_void (ntype);
00958           return -1;            /* can not be evaluated */
00959         case M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR:
00960         case M_TYPE_CHAR:
00961           M_char (ntype, type->unsign);
00962           return M_TYPE_CHAR;
00963         case M_TYPE_BIT_SHORT:  /* ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
00964         case M_TYPE_SHORT:
00965           M_short (ntype, type->unsign);
00966           return M_TYPE_SHORT;
00967         case M_TYPE_INT:
00968           M_int (ntype, type->unsign);
00969           return (ntype->type);
00970         case M_TYPE_BIT_LONG:
00971         case M_TYPE_LONG:
00972           M_long (ntype, type->unsign);
00973           return M_TYPE_LONG;
00974         case M_TYPE_BIT_LLONG:
00975         case M_TYPE_LLONG:
00976           M_llong (ntype, type->unsign);
00977           return M_TYPE_LLONG;
00978         case M_TYPE_BLOCK:      /* the starting address of array is used */
00979         case M_TYPE_POINTER:
00980           M_pointer (ntype);
00981           return M_TYPE_POINTER;
00982           /* BCC - don't promote float to double now - 8/5/96 */
00983         case M_TYPE_FLOAT:
00984           M_float (ntype, type->unsign);
00985           return M_TYPE_FLOAT;
00986         case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:
00987           M_double (ntype, type->unsign);
00988           return M_TYPE_DOUBLE;
00989         case M_TYPE_UNION:
00990         case M_TYPE_STRUCT:
00991           *ntype = *type;
00992           return type->type;
00993         default:
00994           return (-1);
00995         }
00996     }
00997   /* Otherwise use orig hard-coded method to determine info -ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
00998   else
00999     {
01000       switch (M_arch)
01001         {
01002         case M_IMPACT:
01003           return M_impact_call_type2 (type, ntype);
01004         case M_TAHOE:
01005           return M_tahoe_call_type2 (type, ntype);
01006         case M_SPARC:
01007           return M_sparc_call_type2 (type, ntype);
01008         case M_HPPA:
01009           return M_hppa_call_type2 (type, ntype);
01010         case M_X86:
01011           return M_x86_call_type2 (type, ntype);
01012         case M_PLAYDOH:
01013           return M_playdoh_call_type2 (type, ntype);
01014         case M_TI:
01015           return M_ti_call_type2 (type, ntype);
01016         case M_SH:
01017           return M_sh_call_type2 (type, ntype);
01018         case M_STARCORE:
01019           return M_starcore_call_type2 (type, ntype);
01020         case M_ARM:
01021           return M_arm_call_type2 (type, ntype);
01022         case M_WIMS:
01023           return M_wims_call_type2 (type, ntype);
01024         default:
01025           M_assert (0, "M_call_type2: illegal M_arch type");
01026           return -1;
01027         }
01028     }
01029 }

01031 void
01032 M_array_layout (M_Type type, int *offset)
01033 {
01034   /* Use layout database (if specified) to determine info -ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
01035   if (M_use_layout_database)
01036     {
01037       *offset = 0;              /* assume first element is aligned */
01038     }
01039   /* Otherwise use orig hard-coded method to determine info -ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
01040   else
01041     {
01042       switch (M_arch)
01043         {
01044         case M_IMPACT:
01045           M_impact_array_layout (type, offset);
01046           break;
01047         case M_TAHOE:
01048           M_tahoe_array_layout (type, offset);
01049           break;
01050         case M_SPARC:
01051           M_sparc_array_layout (type, offset);
01052           break;
01053         case M_HPPA:
01054           M_hppa_array_layout (type, offset);
01055           break;
01056         case M_X86:
01057           M_x86_array_layout (type, offset);
01058           break;
01059         case M_PLAYDOH:
01060           M_playdoh_array_layout (type, offset);
01061           break;
01062         case M_TI:
01063           M_ti_array_layout (type, offset);
01064           break;
01065         case M_SH:
01066           M_sh_array_layout (type, offset);
01067           break;
01068         case M_STARCORE:
01069           M_starcore_array_layout (type, offset);
01070           break;
01071         case M_ARM:
01072           M_arm_array_layout (type, offset);
01073           break;
01074         case M_WIMS:
01075           M_wims_array_layout (type, offset);
01076         default:
01077           M_assert (0, "M_array_layout: illegal M_arch type");
01078         }
01079     }
01080 }
01081 
01082 int
01083 M_array_align (M_Type type)
01084 {
01085   /* Use layout database (if specified) to determine info -ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
01086   if (M_use_layout_database)
01087     {
01088       return type->align;
01089     }
01090   /* Otherwise use orig hard-coded method to determine info -ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
01091   else
01092     {
01093       switch (M_arch)
01094         {
01095         case M_IMPACT:
01096           return M_impact_array_align (type);
01097         case M_TAHOE:
01098           return M_tahoe_array_align (type);
01099         case M_SPARC:
01100           return M_sparc_array_align (type);
01101         case M_HPPA:
01102           return M_hppa_array_align (type);
01103         case M_X86:
01104           return M_x86_array_align (type);
01105         case M_PLAYDOH:
01106           return M_playdoh_array_align (type);
01107         case M_TI:
01108           return M_ti_array_align (type);
01109         case M_SH:
01110           return M_sh_array_align (type);
01111         case M_STARCORE:
01112           return M_starcore_array_align (type);
01113         case M_ARM:
01114           return M_arm_array_align (type);
01115         case M_WIMS:
01116           return M_wims_array_align (type);
01117         default:
01118           M_assert (0, "M_array_align: illegal M_arch type");
01119           return -1;
01120         }
01121     }
01122 }
01123 
01124 int
01125 M_array_size (M_Type type, int dim)
01126 {
01127   /* Use layout database (if specified) to determine info -ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
01128   if (M_use_layout_database)
01129     {
01130       /* This seems to be a pretty safe way to calculate it -ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
01131       int mod, size, align;
01132       size = type->size;
01133       align = type->align;
01134       mod = size % align;
01135       if (mod != 0)
01136         size += (align - mod);
01137       return (size * dim);
01138     }
01139   /* Otherwise use orig hard-coded method to determine info -ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
01140   else
01141     {
01142       switch (M_arch)
01143         {
01144         case M_IMPACT:
01145           return M_impact_array_size (type, dim);
01146         case M_TAHOE:
01147           return M_tahoe_array_size (type, dim);
01148         case M_SPARC:
01149           return M_sparc_array_size (type, dim);
01150         case M_HPPA:
01151           return M_hppa_array_size (type, dim);
01152         case M_X86:
01153           return M_x86_array_size (type, dim);
01154         case M_PLAYDOH:
01155           return M_playdoh_array_size (type, dim);
01156         case M_TI:
01157           return M_ti_array_size (type, dim);
01158         case M_SH:
01159           return M_sh_array_size (type, dim);
01160         case M_STARCORE:
01161           return M_starcore_array_size (type, dim);
01162         case M_ARM:
01163           return M_arm_array_size (type, dim);
01164         case M_WIMS:
01165           return M_wims_array_size (type, dim);
01166         default:
01167           M_assert (0, "M_array_size: illegal M_arch type");
01168           return -1;
01169         }
01170     }
01171 }
01172 
01173 /* Pass union & field names so can use layout database -ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
01174 void
01175 M_union_layout (int n, _M_Type * type, int *offset, int *bit_offset,
01176                 char *union_name, char *field_name[])
01177 {
01178   int i;
01179   /* Use layout database (if specified) to determine info -ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
01180   if (M_use_layout_database)
01181     {
01182       for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
01183         {
01184           offset[i] = M_read_database_i (union_name, field_name[i], "offset");
01185           bit_offset[i] = 0;    /* IMPACT convention for non-bit-fields */
01186         }
01187     }
01188   /* Otherwise use orig hard-coded method to determine info -ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
01189   else
01190     {
01191       switch (M_arch)
01192         {
01193         case M_IMPACT:
01194           M_impact_union_layout (n, type, offset, bit_offset);
01195           break;
01196         case M_TAHOE:
01197           M_tahoe_union_layout (n, type, offset, bit_offset);
01198           break;
01199         case M_SPARC:
01200           M_sparc_union_layout (n, type, offset, bit_offset);
01201           break;
01202         case M_HPPA:
01203           M_hppa_union_layout (n, type, offset, bit_offset);
01204           break;
01205         case M_X86:
01206           M_x86_union_layout (n, type, offset, bit_offset);
01207           break;
01208         case M_PLAYDOH:
01209           M_playdoh_union_layout (n, type, offset, bit_offset);
01210           break;
01211         case M_TI:
01212           M_ti_union_layout (n, type, offset, bit_offset);
01213           break;
01214         case M_SH:
01215           M_sh_union_layout (n, type, offset, bit_offset);
01216           break;
01217         case M_STARCORE:
01218           M_starcore_union_layout (n, type, offset, bit_offset);
01219           break;
01220         case M_ARM:
01221           M_arm_union_layout (n, type, offset, bit_offset);
01222           break;
01223         case M_WIMS:
01224           M_wims_union_layout (n, type, offset, bit_offset);
01225           break;
01226         default:
01227           M_assert (0, "M_union_layout: illegal M_arch type");
01228         }
01229     }
01230 }
01231 
01232 /* Pass union name so can use layout database -ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
01233 int
01234 M_union_align (int n, _M_Type * type, char *union_name)
01235 {
01236   /* Use layout database (if specified) to determine info -ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
01237   if (M_use_layout_database)
01238     {
01239       return (M_read_database_i ("_HT__user_types", union_name, "align"));
01240     }
01241   /* Otherwise use orig hard-coded method to determine info -ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
01242   else
01243     {
01244       switch (M_arch)
01245         {
01246         case M_IMPACT:
01247           return M_impact_union_align (n, type);
01248         case M_TAHOE:
01249           return M_tahoe_union_align (n, type);
01250         case M_SPARC:
01251           return M_sparc_union_align (n, type);
01252         case M_HPPA:
01253           return M_hppa_union_align (n, type);
01254         case M_X86:
01255           return M_x86_union_align (n, type);
01256         case M_PLAYDOH:
01257           return M_playdoh_union_align (n, type);
01258         case M_TI:
01259           return M_ti_union_align (n, type);
01260         case M_SH:
01261           return M_sh_union_align (n, type);
01262         case M_STARCORE:
01263           return M_starcore_union_align (n, type);
01264         case M_ARM:
01265           return M_arm_union_align (n, type);
01266         case M_WIMS:
01267           return M_wims_union_align (n, type);
01268         default:
01269           M_assert (0, "M_union_align: illegal M_arch type");
01270           return -1;
01271         }
01272     }
01273 }
01274 
01275 /* Pass union name so can use layout database -ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
01276 int
01277 M_union_size (int n, _M_Type * type, char *union_name)
01278 {
01279   /* Use layout database (if specified) to determine info -ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
01280   if (M_use_layout_database)
01281     {
01282       return (M_read_database_i ("_HT__user_types", union_name, "size"));

01288         {

01291         case M_TAHOE:
01292           return M_tahoe_union_size (n, type);
01293         case M_SPARC:

01295         case M_HPPA:

01297         case M_X86:
01298           return M_x86_union_size (n, type);
01299         case M_PLAYDOH:
01300           return M_playdoh_union_size (n, type);
01301         case M_TI:
01302           return M_ti_union_size (n, type);
01303         case M_SH:
01304           return M_sh_union_size (n, type);
01305         case M_STARCORE:

01307         case M_ARM:
01308           return M_arm_union_size (n, type);
01309         case M_WIMS:

01311         default:

01313           return -1;
01314         }
01315     }
01316 }
01317 
01318 /* Pass struct & field names so can use layout database -ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
01319 void
01320 M_struct_layout (int n, _M_Type * type, int *base, int *bit_offset,
01321                  char *struct_name, char *field_name[])
01322 {
01323   /* Use layout database (if specified) to determine info -ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
01324   if (M_use_layout_database)
01325     {
01326       int i, offset;
01327       int size, mod_word, mod_type;
01328       int short_size, char_size, int_size, long_size;
01329 #if 0
01330       /* Debug */
01331       fprintf (stderr, "\nLayout for struct %s:\n", struct_name);
01332 #endif
01333 
01334       /* Get sizes of the types for bit-field calculation (if any) */
01335       char_size = M_read_database_i ("_HT__base_types", "char", "size");
01336       short_size = M_read_database_i ("_HT__base_types", "short", "size");
01337       int_size = M_read_database_i ("_HT__base_types", "int", "size");
01338       long_size = M_read_database_i ("_HT__base_types", "long", "size");
01339 
01340       offset = 0;               /* assume initially aligned */
01341       for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
01342         {
01343           /* Handle bit-fields in a special way */
01344           if ((type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR) ||
01345               (type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_SHORT) ||
01346               (type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_INT) ||
01347               (type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_LONG))
01348             {
01349               /* Get bit-field size */
01350               size = type[i].size;
01351 
01352               /* Get host-compiler's offset for bit field */
01353               offset = M_read_database_i (struct_name, field_name[i],
01354                                           "offset");
01355 
01356               /* Promote the type of bit field so that only one
01357                * load/store is needed (i.e., if 5 bits but crosses
01358                * char boundary, load/store it as a short)
01359                */
01360               if (type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR)
01361                 {
01362                   mod_type = offset % char_size;
01363                   if ((mod_type + size) > char_size)
01364                     {
01365                       type[i].type = M_TYPE_BIT_SHORT;
01366                     }
01367                 }
01368               if (type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_SHORT)
01369                 {
01370                   mod_type = offset % short_size;
01371                   if ((mod_type + size) > short_size)
01372                     {
01373                       type[i].type = M_TYPE_BIT_INT;
01374                     }
01375                 }
01376               if (type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_INT)
01377                 {
01378                   mod_type = offset % int_size;
01379                   if ((mod_type + size) > int_size)
01380                     {
01381                       type[i].type = M_TYPE_BIT_LONG;
01382                     }
01383                 }
01384 
01385               /* IMPACT can't handle bit-fields that cross word boundaries */
01386               mod_word = offset % long_size;
01387               if ((mod_word + size) > long_size)
01388                 {
01389                   I_punt ("\n"
01390                           "M_struct_layout: "
01391                           "IMPACT does not support bit fields \n"
01392                           "                 that cross word boundaries!"
01393                           "\n"
01394                           "     Database: %s\n"
01395                           "    Built for: %s\n"
01396                           "    Structure: \"%s\"\n"
01397                           "        Field: %s\n"
01398                           "         Size: %i\n"
01399                           "       Offset: %i\n",
01400                           M_layout_database_name,
01401                           M_layout_database_desc (),
01402                           struct_name, field_name[i], size, offset);
01403                 }
01404 
01405               /* IMPACT requires bit_offset to be from the rightmost
01406                  p             * bit of the surrounding longword.  Thus, we do
01407                  * this tricky calculation to give the wierd bit_offset.
01408                  *
01409                  *         bit field representation.
01410                  *         |<-------- M_TYPE_LONG --------->|
01411                  *         +--------------------------------+
01412                  *         |00000000111111000000000000000000| <--- bit_mask
01413                  *         +--------------------------------+
01414                  *  offset |<------>|    |<---------------->| bit_offset
01415                  *
01416                  *      To read a bit field (for a long bit field),
01417                  *      1. data = fetch long word
01418                  *      2. data = data & bit_mask
01419                  *      3. data >> bit_offset (logical shift)
01420                  *
01421                  * For char and short bit fields, HtoL adjusts the bit_offset
01422                  * appropriately for that size.  It even works. :) 
01423                */
01424               mod_word = offset % long_size;
01425               bit_offset[i] = offset - mod_word +
01426                 (long_size - mod_word - size);
01427 
01428               /* Figure out base offset for bit-field based on type.
01429                * Use offset, not the funky bit_offset calculated above
01430                */
01431               if (type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR)
01432                 {
01433                   base[i] = offset & (~(char_size - 1));
01434 
01435                   /* Compensate for little endian ordering of
01436                    * bytes -ITI(JCG) 6/99
01437                    */
01438                   if (M_read_database_i ("_HT__info",
01439                                          "little_endian", "value") == 1)
01440                     {
01441                       if ((offset & 31) >= 24)
01442                         base[i] -= 24;
01443                       else if ((offset & 31) >= 16)
01444                         base[i] -= 8;
01445                       else if ((offset & 31) >= 8)
01446                         base[i] += 8;
01447                       else
01448                         base[i] += 24;
01449                     }
01450                 }
01451               else if (type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_SHORT)
01452                 {
01453                   base[i] = offset & (~(short_size - 1));
01454 
01455                   /* Compensate for little endian ordering of
01456                    * shorts -ITI(JCG) 6/99
01457                    */
01458                   if (M_read_database_i ("_HT__info",
01459                                          "little_endian", "value") == 1)
01460                     {
01461                       if ((offset & 31) >= 16)
01462                         base[i] -= 16;
01463                       else
01464                         base[i] += 16;
01465                     }
01466                 }
01467               else if (type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_INT)
01468                 {
01469                   base[i] = offset & (~(int_size - 1));
01470                 }
01471               else if (type[i].type == M_TYPE_BIT_LONG)
01472                 {
01473                   base[i] = offset & (~(long_size - 1));
01474                 }
01475               else
01476                 {
01477                   I_punt ("M_struct_layout: Unexpected field type %i",
01478                           type[i].type);
01479                 }
01480             }
01481 
01482           /* Otherwise, place how compiler indicates */
01483           else
01484             {
01485               base[i] = M_read_database_i (struct_name, field_name[i],
01486                                            "offset");
01487               bit_offset[i] = 0;        /* IMPACT convention for 
01488                                            non-bit-fields */
01489             }
01490 
01491 #if 0
01492           /* Debug */
01493           fprintf (stderr,
01494                    "  %8s  base: %5i   bit_offset: %5i  size: %i  type:%i\n",
01495                    field_name[i], base[i], bit_offset[i], type[i].size,
01496                    type[i].type);
01497 #endif
01498         }
01499     }
01500   /* Otherwise use orig hard-coded method to determine info -ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
01501   else
01502     {
01503       switch (M_arch)
01504         {
01505         case M_IMPACT:
01506           M_impact_struct_layout (n, type, base, bit_offset);
01507           break;
01508         case M_TAHOE:
01509           M_tahoe_struct_layout (n, type, base, bit_offset);
01510           break;
01511         case M_SPARC:
01512           M_sparc_struct_layout (n, type, base, bit_offset);
01513           break;
01514         case M_HPPA:
01515           M_hppa_struct_layout (n, type, base, bit_offset);
01516           break;
01517         case M_X86:
01518           M_x86_struct_layout (n, type, base, bit_offset);
01519           break;
01520         case M_PLAYDOH:
01521           M_playdoh_struct_layout (n, type, base, bit_offset);
01522           break;
01523         case M_TI:
01524           M_ti_struct_layout (n, type, base, bit_offset);
01525           break;
01526         case M_SH:
01527           M_sh_struct_layout (n, type, base, bit_offset);
01528           break;
01529         case M_STARCORE:
01530           M_starcore_struct_layout (n, type, base, bit_offset);
01531           break;
01532         case M_ARM:
01533           M_arm_struct_layout (n, type, base, bit_offset);
01534           break;
01535         case M_WIMS:
01536           M_wims_struct_layout (n, type, base, bit_offset);
01537           break;
01538         default:
01539           M_assert (0, "M_struct_layout: illegal M_arch type");
01540         }
01541     }
01542 }
01543

01665 
01666 int
01667 M_default_layout_retvar (M_Param param, int purpose)
01668 {
01669   if (param->mtype.type & (M_TYPE_STRUCT | M_TYPE_UNION))
01670     param->mode = M_INDIRECT_THRU_REGISTER;
01671   else
01672     param->mode = M_THRU_REGISTER;
01673   return (param->mode == M_INDIRECT_THRU_REGISTER);
01674 }
01675

01684     case M_TAHOE:
01685       return M_tahoe_layout_retvar (param, purpose);
01686     case M_SPARC:
01687       return M_default_layout_retvar (param, purpose);
01688     case M_HPPA:
01689       return M_default_layout_retvar (param, purpose);
01690     case M_X86:
01691       return M_default_layout_retvar (param, purpose);
01692     case M_PLAYDOH:
01693       return M_default_layout_retvar (param, purpose);
01694     case M_TI:
01695       return M_default_layout_retvar (param, purpose);
01696     case M_SH:
01697       return M_default_layout_retvar (param, purpose);

01709 
01710 
01711 int
01712 M_fnvar_layout (int n, _M_Type * type, long int *offset, int *mode, int *reg,
01713                 int *paddr, char **base_macro, int *su_sreg, int *su_ereg,
01714                 int *pcount, int need_ST, int purpose)
01715 /*
01716  *      n = number of arguments to be passed for this jsr.
01717  *      type[] = data types of arguments.
01718  *      offset[] = offsets from $SP or $FP, where the arguments are placed.
01719  *      mode[] = 1) M_THRU_REGISTER: pass thru register
01720  *               2) M_THRU_MEMORY: pass thru memory
01721  *               3) M_INDIRECT_THRU_REGISTER: pass thru memory, allocate space
01722  *                      elsewhere, but pass a pointer thru register
01723  *               4) M_INDIRECT_THRU_MEMORY: pass thru memory, allocate
01724  *                      space elsewhere, and pass a pointer thru memory
01725  *      reg[] = the macro register number when pass-thru register.
01726  *      paddr[] = the starting address of INDIRECT mode.
01727  *      base_macro = $SP or $FP
01728  *      su_sreg = first reg used for multi-reg param
01729  *      su_ereg = last reg used for multi-reg param
01730  *      pcount = number of parameter regs created
01731  *      need_ST = does the function return a structure?
01732  *      purpose = for calling or for receiving arguments?
01733  */
01734                         /* need to return structure */
01735 {
01736   switch (M_arch)
01737     {
01738     case M_IMPACT:
01739       return M_impact_fnvar_layout (n, type, offset, mode, reg, paddr,
01740                                     base_macro, su_sreg, su_ereg,
01741                                     pcount, need_ST, purpose);
01742     case M_TAHOE:
01743       return M_tahoe_fnvar_layout (n, type, offset, mode, reg, paddr,
01744                                    base_macro, su_sreg, su_ereg,
01745                                    pcount, need_ST, purpose);
01746     case M_SPARC:
01747       return M_sparc_fnvar_layout (n, type, offset, mode, reg, paddr,
01748                                    base_macro, su_sreg, su_ereg,
01749                                    pcount, need_ST, purpose);
01750     case M_HPPA:
01751       return M_hppa_fnvar_layout (n, type, offset, mode, reg, paddr,
01752                                   base_macro, su_sreg, su_ereg,
01753                                   pcount, need_ST, purpose);
01754     case M_X86:
01755       return M_x86_fnvar_layout (n, type, offset, mode, reg, paddr,
01756                                  base_macro, su_sreg, su_ereg,
01757                                  pcount, need_ST, purpose);
01758     case M_PLAYDOH:
01759       return M_playdoh_fnvar_layout (n, type, offset, mode, reg, paddr,
01760                                      base_macro, su_sreg, su_ereg,
01761                                      pcount, need_ST, purpose);
01762     case M_TI:
01763       return M_ti_fnvar_layout (n, type, offset, mode, reg, paddr,
01764                                 base_macro, su_sreg, su_ereg,
01765                                 pcount, need_ST, purpose);
01766     case M_SH:
01767       return M_sh_fnvar_layout (n, type, offset, mode, reg, paddr,
01768                                 base_macro, su_sreg, su_ereg,
01769                                 pcount, need_ST, purpose);
01770     case M_STARCORE:
01771       return M_starcore_fnvar_layout (n, type, offset, mode, reg, paddr,
01772                                       base_macro, su_sreg, su_ereg,
01773                                       pcount, need_ST, purpose);
01774     case M_ARM:
01775       return M_arm_fnvar_layout (n, type, offset, mode, reg, paddr,
01776                                  base_macro, su_sreg, su_ereg,
01777                                  pcount, need_ST, purpose);
01778     case M_WIMS:
01779       return M_wims_fnvar_layout (n, type, offset, mode, reg, paddr,
01780                                   base_macro, su_sreg, su_ereg,
01781                                   pcount, need_ST, purpose);
01782     default:
01783       M_assert (0, "M_fnvar_layout: illegal M_arch type");
01784       return -1;
01785     }
01786 }
01787

01798       return M_sparc_lvar_layout (n, type, offset, base_macro);
01799     case M_HPPA:
01800       return M_hppa_lvar_layout (n, type, offset, base_macro);
01801     case M_X86:
01802       return M_x86_lvar_layout (n, type, offset, base_macro);
01803     case M_PLAYDOH:
01804       return M_playdoh_lvar_layout (n, type, offset, base_macro);
01805     case M_TI:

01813     case M_WIMS:

01821 int
01822 M_native_int_register_ctype (void)
01823 {
01824   switch (M_arch)
01825     {
01826     case M_TAHOE:
01827       return L_CTYPE_LLONG;
01828     case M_IMPACT:
01829     case M_SPARC:
01830     case M_HPPA:
01831     case M_X86:
01832     case M_PLAYDOH:
01833     case M_TI:
01834     case M_SH:
01835     case M_STARCORE:
01836     case M_ARM:
01837     case M_WIMS:
01838       return L_CTYPE_INT;
01839     default:
01840       M_assert (0, "M_native_int_register_ctype: illegal M_arch type");
01841       return -1;
01842     }
01843 
01844 }
01845 
01846 int
01847 M_native_int_register_mtype (void)
01848 {
01849   switch (M_arch)
01850     {
01851     case M_TAHOE:
01852       return M_TYPE_LLONG;
01853     case M_IMPACT:
01854     case M_SPARC:
01855     case M_HPPA:
01856     case M_X86:
01857     case M_PLAYDOH:
01858     case M_TI:
01859     case M_SH:
01860     case M_STARCORE:
01861     case M_ARM:
01862     case M_WIMS:
01863       return M_TYPE_INT;
01864     default:
01865       M_assert (0, "M_native_int_register_mtype: illegal M_arch type");
01866       return -1;
01867     }
01868 
01869 }
01870 
01871 int
01872 M_no_short_int (void)
01873 {
01874   /* Use layout database (if specified) to determine info -ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
01875   if (M_use_layout_database)
01876     {
01877       return (M_read_database_i ("_HT__base_types", "short", "size") ==
01878               M_read_database_i ("_HT__base_types", "int", "size"));
01879     }
01880   /* Otherwise use orig hard-coded method to determine info -ITI(JCG) 2/99 */
01881   else
01882     {
01883       switch (M_arch)
01884         {
01885         case M_IMPACT:
01886           return M_impact_no_short_int ();
01887         case M_TAHOE:
01888           return M_tahoe_no_short_int ();
01889         case M_SPARC:
01890           return M_sparc_no_short_int ();
01891         case M_HPPA:
01892           return M_hppa_no_short_int ();
01893         case M_X86:
01894           return M_x86_no_short_int ();
01895         case M_PLAYDOH:
01896           return M_playdoh_no_short_int ();
01897         case M_TI:
01898           return M_ti_no_short_int ();
01899         case M_SH:
01900           return M_sh_no_short_int ();
01901         case M_STARCORE:
01902           return M_starcore_no_short_int ();
01903         case M_ARM:
01904           return M_arm_no_short_int ();
01905         case M_WIMS:
01906           return M_wims_no_short_int ();
01907         default:
01908           M_assert (0, "M_no_short_int: illegal M_arch type");
01909           return -1;
01910         }
01911     }
01912 }
01913 
01914 int
01915 M_compatible_type (M_Type type1, M_Type type2)
01916 {
01917   _M_Type t1, t2;
01918   M_eval_type (type1, &t1);
01919   M_eval_type (type2, &t2);
01920   /*
01921    *  sign does not matter.
01922    */
01923   return (t1.type == t2.type);
01924 }

02191 int 
02192 M_return_value_thru_stack()
02193 {
02194     switch (M_arch) {
02195       case M_IMPACT:
02196         return 0;
02197       case M_TAHOE:
02198         return 0;
02199       case M_SPARC:
02200         return 0;
02201       case M_HPPA:
02202         return 0;
02203       case M_X86:
02204         return 0;
02205       case M_PLAYDOH:
02206         return 0;
02207       case M_TI:
02208         return 0;
02209       case M_SH:
02210         return 0;
02211       case M_STARCORE:
02212         return 0;
02213       case M_ARM:
02214         return 0;
02215       case M_WIMS:
02216         return 1;
02217       default:
02218         M_assert(0, "illegal M_arch type");
02219         return 0;
02220     }
02221     return 0;
02222 }
02223 
02224 int
02225 M_return_value_offset()
02226 {
02227     int off;
02228     switch (M_arch) {
02229       case M_IMPACT:
02230         off = 0;
02231         break;
02232       case M_TAHOE:
02233         off = 0;
02234         break;
02235       case M_SPARC:
02236         off = 0;
02237         break;
02238       case M_HPPA:
02239         off = 0;
02240         break;
02241       case M_X86:
02242         off = 0;
02243         break;
02244       case M_PLAYDOH:
02245         off = 0;
02246         break;
02247       case M_TI:
02248         off = 0;
02249         break;
02250       case M_SH:
02251         off = 0;
02252         break;
02253       case M_STARCORE:
02254         off = 0;
02255         break;
02256       case M_ARM:
02257         off = 0;
02258         break;
02259       case M_WIMS:
02260         off = 0;
02261         break;
02262       default:
02263         M_assert(0, "illegal M_arch type");
02264         return 0;
02265     }
02266     // if stack grows from low to high
02267     // set off to size of the return value (M_'arch'_SIZE_MAX) above
02268     // and do off = -off before returning
02269     return off;
02270 }

02396 /****************************************************************************
02397  *
02398  * routine: M_extra_pred_define_opcode()
02399  * purpose: Determine if the proc_opc opcode generates a predicate.
02400  *          Only machine specific predicate generating opcodes above and
02401  *          beyond the normal pred defines, clears, and stores need to be
02402  *          listed.
02403  * input: 
02404  * output:
02405  * returns:
02406  * modified:
02407  * note:
02408  *-------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
02409 
02410 int
02411 M_extra_pred_define_opcode (int proc_opc)
02412 {
02413   switch (M_arch)
02414     {
02415     case M_TAHOE:
02416       return (M_tahoe_extra_pred_define_opcode (proc_opc));
02417     case M_STARCORE:
02418       return (M_starcore_extra_pred_define_opcode (proc_opc));
02419     case M_IMPACT:
02420       return (0);
02421     case M_HPPA:
02422       return (0);
02423     case M_PLAYDOH:
02424       return (0);
02425     default:
02426       M_assert (0, "illegal M_arch type");
02427       return (0);
02428     }
02429 }

02500 
02501 int
02502 M_dataflow_macro (int id)
02503 {
02504   switch (M_arch)
02505     {
02506     case M_IMPACT:
02507       return M_impact_dataflow_macro (id);
02508     case M_TAHOE:
02509       return M_tahoe_dataflow_macro (id);
02510     case M_HPPA:
02511       return M_hppa_dataflow_macro (id);
02512     case M_SPARC:
02513       return M_sparc_dataflow_macro (id);
02514     case M_X86:
02515     case M_PLAYDOH:
02516     case M_TI:
02517     case M_ARM:
02518     case M_WIMS:
02519       return ((id >= L_MAC_P0 && id <= L_MAC_P64) || (id >= L_MAC_LAST));
02520     case M_SH:
02521       return M_sh_dataflow_macro (id);
02522     case M_STARCORE:
02523       return M_starcore_dataflow_macro (id);
02524     default:
02525       M_assert (0, "M_dataflow_macro: illegal M_arch type");
02526     }
02527   return 1;
02528 }
02529 
02530 int
02531 M_zero_macro (L_Operand *opd)
02532 {
02533   int mac;
02534   if (!opd ||
02535       !L_is_macro(opd))
02536     return 0;
02537 
02538   mac = opd->value.mac;
02539 
02540   switch (M_arch)
02541     {
02542     case M_TAHOE:
02543       if (mac == TAHOE_MAC_ZERO)
02544         return 1;
02545       break;
02546 
02547     default:
02548       break;
02549     }
02550   return 0;
02551 }
02552 
02553 int
02554 M_subroutine_call (int opc)
02555 {
02556   switch (M_arch)
02557     {
02558     case M_IMPACT:
02559       return M_impact_subroutine_call (opc);
02560     case M_TAHOE:
02561       return M_tahoe_subroutine_call (opc);
02562     case M_SPARC:
02563       return M_sparc_subroutine_call (opc);
02564     case M_HPPA:
02565       return M_hppa_subroutine_call (opc);
02566     case M_X86:
02567       return M_x86_subroutine_call (opc);
02568     case M_PLAYDOH:
02569       return M_playdoh_subroutine_call (opc);
02570     case M_TI:
02571       return M_ti_subroutine_call (opc);
02572     case M_SH:
02573       return M_sh_subroutine_call (opc);
02574     case M_STARCORE:
02575       return M_starcore_subroutine_call (opc);
02576     case M_ARM:
02577       return M_arm_subroutine_call (opc);
02578     case M_WIMS:
02579       return M_wims_subroutine_call (opc);
02580     default:
02581       M_assert (0, "M_subroutine_call: illegal M_arch type");
02582       return 0;
02583     }
02584 }

02593       break;

02596       break;

02598       M_define_macros_sparc (sym_tbl);
02599       break;
02600     case M_HPPA:
02601       M_define_macros_hppa (sym_tbl);
02602       break;
02603     case M_X86:
02604       M_define_macros_x86 (sym_tbl);
02605       break;
02606     case M_PLAYDOH:
02607       M_define_macros_playdoh (sym_tbl);
02608       break;
02609     case M_TI:
02610       M_define_macros_ti (sym_tbl);
02611       break;
02612     case M_SH:
02613       M_define_macros_sh (sym_tbl);
02614       break;
02615     case M_BX86:
02616       M_define_macros_bx86 (sym_tbl);
02617       break;
02618     case M_STARCORE:
02619       M_define_macros_starcore (sym_tbl);
02620       break;
02621     case M_ARM:
02622       M_define_macros_arm (sym_tbl);
02623       break;
02624     case M_WIMS:
02625       M_define_macros_wims (sym_tbl);
02626       break;

02629     }

02720 /* Return strings for architecture/model specific opcodes */
02721 char *
02722 M_get_opcode_name (int id)
02723 {
02724   switch (M_arch)
02725     {
02726     case M_TAHOE:
02727       /*        return M_get_opcode_name_tahoe(id); */
02728     case M_IMPACT:
02729       return ("?");  /* Currently only supports Lcode opcodes -JCG 4/99 */
02730 #if 0
02731     case M_SPARC:
02732       return M_get_opcode_name_sparc (id);
02733 #endif
02734     case M_HPPA:
02735       return M_get_opcode_name_hppa (id);
02736     case M_X86:
02737       return M_get_opcode_name_x86 (id);
02738     case M_PLAYDOH:
02739       return M_get_opcode_name_playdoh (id);
02740     case M_TI:
02741       return M_get_opcode_name_ti (id);
02742 #if 0
02743     case M_SH:
02744       return M_get_opcode_name_sh (id);
02745 #endif
02746     case M_BX86:
02747       return M_get_opcode_name_bx86 (id);
02748     case M_STARCORE:
02749       return M_get_opcode_name_starcore (id);
02750     case M_ARM:
02751       return M_get_opcode_name_arm (id);
02752     case M_WIMS:
02753       return M_get_opcode_name_wims (id);
02754     default:
02755       M_assert (0, "M_get_opcode_name: illegal M_arch type");
02756       return (char *) 0;
02757     }
02758 }

02760 /*
02761  * Return true (1) if the instruction is supported in the hardware of the
02762  * processor.  Return false (0) otherwise.
02763  */
02764 int
02765 M_oper_supported_in_arch (int opc)
02766 {
02767   switch (M_arch)
02768     {
02769     case M_IMPACT:
02770       return M_oper_supported_in_arch_impact (opc);
02771     case M_TAHOE:
02772       return M_oper_supported_in_arch_tahoe (opc);
02773     case M_SPARC:
02774       return M_oper_supported_in_arch_sparc (opc);
02775     case M_HPPA:
02776       return M_oper_supported_in_arch_hppa (opc);
02777     case M_X86:
02778       return M_oper_supported_in_arch_x86 (opc);
02779     case M_PLAYDOH:
02780       return M_oper_supported_in_arch_playdoh (opc);
02781     case M_TI:
02782       return M_oper_supported_in_arch_ti (opc);
02783     case M_SH:
02784       return M_oper_supported_in_arch_sh (opc);
02785     case M_BX86:
02786       return M_oper_supported_in_arch_bx86 (opc);
02787     case M_STARCORE:
02788       return M_oper_supported_in_arch_starcore (opc);
02789     case M_ARM:
02790       return M_oper_supported_in_arch_arm (opc);
02791     case M_WIMS:
02792       return M_oper_supported_in_arch_wims (opc);
02793     default:
02794       M_assert (0, "M_oper_supported_in_arch: illegal M_arch type");
02795       return 0;
02796     }
02797 }
02798 
02799 /*
02800  * Returns the number of machine instructions required to implement the
02801  * specified oper in the best case.  It is assumed that this is for 
02802  * supported instructions.  A call to M_oper_supported_in_arch should be
02803  * made for abnormal instructions.
02804  */
02805 int
02806 M_num_oper_required_for (L_Oper * oper, char *name)
02807 {
02808   switch (M_arch)
02809     {
02810     case M_IMPACT:
02811       return M_num_oper_required_for_impact (oper, name);
02812     case M_TAHOE:
02813       return M_num_oper_required_for_tahoe (oper, name);
02814     case M_SPARC:
02815       return M_num_oper_required_for_sparc (oper, name);
02816     case M_HPPA:
02817       return M_num_oper_required_for_hppa (oper, name);
02818     case M_X86:
02819       return M_num_oper_required_for_x86 (oper, name);
02820     case M_PLAYDOH:
02821       return M_num_oper_required_for_playdoh (oper, name);
02822     case M_TI:
02823       return M_num_oper_required_for_ti (oper, name);
02824     case M_SH:
02825       return M_num_oper_required_for_sh (oper, name);
02826     case M_BX86:
02827       return M_num_oper_required_for_bx86 (oper, name);
02828     case M_STARCORE:
02829       return M_num_oper_required_for_starcore (oper, name);
02830     case M_ARM:
02831       return M_num_oper_required_for_arm (oper, name);
02832     case M_WIMS:
02833       return M_num_oper_required_for_wims (oper, name);
02834     default:
02835       M_assert (0, "M_num_oper_required_for: illegal M_arch type");
02836       return 0;
02837     }
02838 }
02839 
02840 int
02841 M_is_stack_operand (L_Operand * operand)
02842 {
02843   if (operand == NULL)
02844     return 0;
02845 
02846   switch (M_arch)
02847     {
02848     case M_IMPACT:
02849       return M_is_stack_operand_impact (operand);
02850     case M_TAHOE:
02851       return M_is_stack_operand_tahoe (operand);
02852     case M_SPARC:
02853       return M_is_stack_operand_sparc (operand);
02854     case M_HPPA:
02855       return M_is_stack_operand_hppa (operand);
02856     case M_X86:
02857       return M_is_stack_operand_x86 (operand);
02858     case M_PLAYDOH:
02859       return M_is_stack_operand_playdoh (operand);
02860     case M_TI:
02861       return M_is_stack_operand_ti (operand);
02862     case M_SH:
02863       return M_is_stack_operand_sh (operand);
02864     case M_BX86:
02865       return M_is_stack_operand_bx86 (operand);
02866     case M_STARCORE:
02867       return M_is_stack_operand_starcore (operand);
02868     case M_ARM:
02869       return M_is_stack_operand_arm (operand);
02870     case M_WIMS:
02871       return M_is_stack_operand_wims (operand);
02872     default:
02873       M_assert (0, "M_is_stack_operand: illegal M_arch type");
02874       return 0;
02875     }
02876 }

02878 int
02879 M_is_unsafe_macro (L_Operand * operand)
02880 {
02881   if (operand == NULL)
02882     return 0;
02883 
02884   switch (M_arch)
02885     {
02886     case M_IMPACT:
02887       return M_is_unsafe_macro_impact (operand);
02888     case M_TAHOE:
02889       return M_is_unsafe_macro_tahoe (operand);
02890     case M_SPARC:
02891       return M_is_unsafe_macro_sparc (operand);
02892     case M_HPPA:
02893       return M_is_unsafe_macro_hppa (operand);
02894     case M_X86:
02895       return M_is_unsafe_macro_x86 (operand);
02896     case M_PLAYDOH:
02897       return M_is_unsafe_macro_playdoh (operand);
02898     case M_TI:
02899       return M_is_unsafe_macro_ti (operand);
02900     case M_SH:
02901       return M_is_unsafe_macro_sh (operand);
02902     case M_BX86:
02903       return M_is_unsafe_macro_bx86 (operand);
02904     case M_STARCORE:
02905       return M_is_unsafe_macro_starcore (operand);
02906     case M_ARM:
02907       return M_is_unsafe_macro_arm (operand);
02908     case M_WIMS:
02909       return M_is_unsafe_macro_wims (operand);
02910     default:
02911       M_assert (0, "M_is_unsafe_macro: illegal M_arch type");
02912       return 0;
02913     }
02914 }

02985 
02986 /*
02987  *      For L_independent_memory_ops, for now this is hardwired for all archs
02988  *      right now until Dave G mods his stuff.
02989  *              first = location of first address operand
02990  *              number = number of address operands
02991  *              proc_opc = processor specific opcode
02992  */
02993 
02994 void
02995 M_get_memory_operands (int *first, int *number, int proc_opc)
02996 {
02997   switch (M_arch)
02998     {
02999     case M_IMPACT:
03000     case M_HPPA:
03001     case M_PLAYDOH:
03002     case M_SPARC:
03003     case M_TI:
03004     case M_SH:
03005     case M_ARM:
03006     case M_WIMS:
03007       *first = 0;
03008       *number = 2;
03009       break;
03010     case M_TAHOE:
03011       M_get_memory_operands_tahoe (first, number, proc_opc);
03012       break;
03013     case M_X86:
03014       M_get_memory_operands_x86 (first, number, proc_opc);
03015       break;
03016     case M_BX86:
03017       M_get_memory_operands_bx86 (first, number, proc_opc);
03018       break;
03019     case M_STARCORE:
03020       M_get_memory_operands_starcore (first, number, proc_opc);
03021       break;
03022     default:
03023       *first = 0;
03024       *number = 2;
03025     }
03026 }

03037     case M_SPARC:
03038       return M_num_registers_sparc (ctype);
03039     case M_HPPA:
03040       return M_num_registers_hppa (ctype);
03041     case M_X86:
03042       return M_num_registers_x86 (ctype);
03043     case M_PLAYDOH:
03044       return M_num_registers_playdoh (ctype);
03045     case M_TI:
03046       return M_num_registers_ti (ctype);
03047     case M_SH:
03048       return M_num_registers_sh (ctype);
03049     case M_BX86:
03050       return M_num_registers_bx86 (ctype);
03051     case M_STARCORE:
03052       return M_num_registers_starcore (ctype);
03053     case M_ARM:
03054       return M_num_registers_arm (ctype);
03055     case M_WIMS:
03056       return M_num_registers_wims (ctype);
03057     default:

03068     M_assert (0, "M_memory_access_size: op is NULL");

03072     case M_X86:
03073       return (M_memory_access_size_x86 (op));
03074     case M_BX86:
03075       return (M_memory_access_size_bx86 (op));
03076     case M_STARCORE:
03077       return (M_memory_access_size_starcore (op));
03078     case M_IMPACT:
03079     case M_TAHOE:
03080     case M_SPARC:
03081     case M_HPPA:
03082     case M_PLAYDOH:
03083     case M_TI:
03084     case M_SH:
03085     case M_ARM:
03086     case M_WIMS:
03087     default:
03088       M_assert (0, "M_memory_access_size: illegal opcode");
03089       return (0);
03090     }
03091 }

03128     case M_X86:
03129     case M_BX86:
03130       return (1);
03131     case M_IMPACT:
03132     case M_TAHOE:
03133     case M_SPARC:
03134     case M_HPPA:
03135     case M_PLAYDOH:
03136     case M_TI:
03137     case M_SH:
03138     case M_STARCORE:
03139     case M_ARM:
03140     case M_WIMS:
03141     default:
03142       return (0);

03145 
03146 int
03147 M_is_implicit_memory_op (L_Oper * oper)
03148 {
03149 
03150   switch (M_arch)
03151     {
03152     case M_X86:
03153       return (M_is_implicit_memory_op_x86 (oper));
03154     case M_BX86:
03155       return (M_is_implicit_memory_op_bx86 (oper));
03156     case M_STARCORE:
03157       return (M_is_implicit_memory_op_starcore (oper));
03158     case M_IMPACT:
03159     case M_TAHOE:
03160     case M_SPARC:
03161     case M_HPPA:
03162     case M_PLAYDOH:
03163     case M_TI:
03164     case M_SH:
03165     case M_ARM:
03166     case M_WIMS:
03167     default:
03168       return (0);
03169     }
03170 }
03171 
03172 int
03173 M_opc_from_proc_opc (int proc_opc)
03174 {
03175   switch (M_arch)
03176     {
03177     case M_X86:
03178     case M_IMPACT:
03179     case M_SPARC:
03180     case M_HPPA:
03181     case M_TI:
03182     case M_SH:
03183     case M_BX86:
03184     case M_ARM:
03185     case M_WIMS:
03186       M_assert (0, "M_opc_from_proc_opc: Illegal architecture!");
03187       return (0);
03188     case M_TAHOE:
03189       return (M_opc_from_proc_opc_tahoe (proc_opc));
03190     case M_PLAYDOH:
03191       return (M_opc_from_proc_opc_playdoh (proc_opc));
03192     case M_STARCORE:
03193       return (M_opc_from_proc_opc_starcore (proc_opc));
03194     default:
03195       M_assert (0, "M_opc_from_proc_opc: Illegal architecture!");
03196       return (0);
03197     }
03198 }
03199 
03200 /* IA64 sias 20000517 */
03201 
03202 int
03203 M_cannot_predicate (L_Oper * oper)
03204 {
03205 
03206   switch (M_arch)
03207     {
03208     case M_TAHOE:
03209       return (M_cannot_predicate_tahoe (oper));
03210     case M_IMPACT:
03211     case M_PLAYDOH:
03212     case M_ARM:
03213       return (0);
03214     default:
03215       return (1);
03216     }
03217 }
03218 
03219 /* Return a bit vector that represents the src operands to try and coalesce.
03220  * 01 - src[0], 10 - src[1], 11 - src[0] & src[1]
03221  */
03222 int
03223 M_coalescing_oper (L_Oper *oper)
03224 {
03225   switch (M_arch)
03226     {
03227     case M_STARCORE:
03228       return (M_starcore_coalescing_oper (oper));
03229     default:
03230       return 0;
03231     }
03232 }

03235 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
03236 
03237 
03238 /* align_bit = bits, offset = bytes */
03239 static int
03240 M_align_offset(int offset, int align_bit)
03241 {
03242   int mod;
03243   int align = align_bit / 8;
03244 
03245   if ((align_bit % 8) != 0)
03246     I_punt("M_align_offset: alignment not multiple of 8 = %d\n",
03247            align_bit);
03248 
03249   mod = offset % align;
03250   if (mod != 0)
03251     offset += (align - mod);  
03252 
03253   return offset;
03254 }
